The _ImageFilterServlet_ writes to the _HttpServletResponse_'s _OutputStream_ in the end. One possible exception could be that the socket gets closed on the client-side (e.g. user closes browser tab) leading to a _ClientAbortException:  java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe_ being re-thrown as -_java.lang.RuntimeException_, leading to a full stack trace being written out to the log. The _ClientAbortException_ is implementation specific, but the part writing to the _OutputStream_ could still stand in its isolated try-catch examining if the root cause is a _SocketException_ of that type and thus ignore it.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Put a breakpoint on l216 of the ImageFilterServlet (ImageEffectsPlugin 1.1.4)
2. Open the _Prettify the page with an image (step 4 of 9)_ page of the demo space in the editor, select one of the images and click on _Properties_ in the property panel
3. Wait for the break, and close the tab, you'll get a trace like the one attached
fields.summary: ImageFilterServlet re-throws java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29338].
  {panel}

Some of the joking aside, there may be some rewarding opportunity for collaboration with or integrating of the Docear suite of tools to Atlassian's Confluence et al. Though the mind-mapping software suite is intended for use by academics, I argue that in this Information Age, who does not need help keeping track of all the details which constitute the Truth of the matter?

Some notes on Truth:
The Google Search is one of the best general purpose providers of truth on the internet. However, the algorithm suffers from certain issues, particularly regarding the quantity of cross-links generated as a result of human behavior (e.g. painful experiences with sub-par technology vs. technology which "just works").

Wikipedia has largely addressed the need to consolidate certain [Google] Searches for truth into a reviewed, standardized, human-readable layout, thus augmenting our ability to understand and comprehend the unknown or unfamiliar. Wikipedia suffers from the inability to test Truth propositions, and so has policies which remove Primary authors from the allowable citation pool in preference to Journalists, or Secondary Sources, who may someday cover the material so that mortals may understand it (or something--I have yet to hear a sensible explanation for this policy).

Both tools may be used easily as consumers, with some difficulty as a producer. However, there is a yet a lot to be desired in the gap between knowing and creating. For instance, take GitHub and BitBucket. Those are social tools for creation of software. Now extend those ideas to logic, personal preferences, and what we do as human beings, and we ought to see some computer augmentation of our abilities to discern fact from fiction.

h4. Problem
After inserting a link to an anchor in a page, Confluence seems to be truncating part the resulting URL, making the link useless. 
For example, a link to an anchor named "section two" would be rendered as 
{noformat}
https://<account>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/<spaceKey>/<page>#<page>-sectiontw
{noformat}
(note the missing "o" letter at the end of the link).
The issue seems to be intermittent.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Create a numeric list with titles that will eventually be links.  (such as: 1. link one, 2. link two, etc.)
# Create 4 h3 headers with some text, below the numbered list ("section 1", "section 2", etc.)
# Above each h3, insert anchors ("section one", "section two", "section three", etc.)
# For each of the items in the enumerated list at the top, highlight the text and click the link icon.
# For the link, use the corresponding anchor that was just created (i.e., "#section one" or "#section two").
# Save the page.

h4. Expected Result
Links would point to the anchors correctly

h4. Actual Result
Some of the links are not rendered properly

h4. Reproduced using the following environments:
* OS: Windows 7
Chrome 26.0.x
IE9
* MacBook Pro OSX 10.8.3
Safari 6.0.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29242].
  {panel}

Error message is rendered:
Error rendering macro 'viewdoc' : java.lang.RuntimeException: com.aspose.words.FileCorruptedException: The document appears to be corrupted and cannot be loaded.

From http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_Open_XML:
"Starting with Microsoft Office 2007, the Office Open XML file formats have become the default[3] target file format of Microsoft Office.[4][5] Microsoft Office 2010 provides read support for ECMA-376, read/write support for ISO/IEC 29500 Transitional, and read support for ISO/IEC 29500 Strict.[6] Microsoft Office 2013 additionally supports both reading and writing of ISO/IEC 29500 Strict.[7]"
It looks like a file with the .docx extension may be either ISO 29500 Transitional or ISO 29500 Strict. Word 2010 only writes the Transitional type of ISO 29500. It looks like Word 2013 could be either Transitional or Strict. See:
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd797428.aspx
But in theory Strict is supposed to be a subset of Transitional. So if a Transitional document created by Word 2010 works, you'd think that a Strict one would work too. However, it seems that when they standardized Strict they also made a change to namespaces. That is probably the key to fixing this. For more info see: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/dmahugh/archive/2010/04/06/office-s-support-for-iso-iec-29500-strict.aspx
Also http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_Open_XML#Compatibility_between_versions states:
"Applications able to read documents compliant to ECMA-376 edition 1 will regard ISO/IEC 29500-4 Transitional documents containing ISO 8601 dates as corrupt."

.docx from 2010 displays normally

  {panel}

This was found in AOD and reproduced in EAC.
Steps in AOD:
Include macro in page with a label selected
Add label to arbitrary page
Manually rebuild the index

For EAC after testing we waited several minutes for the auto index rebuild and couldn't get the macro to work properly

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29207].
  {panel}

The Google Documents List only appears to display documents owned by me. 

As a collaboration tool this is extremely limiting.

Details:
# It includes a title that cannot be edited "Documents belonging to Daniel Harvey" and this appears to be true i.e. only docs owned by myself
# The macro has a "Filter by Author" but entering anything here seems to cause the list to be empty.

Please help!
fields.summary: Google Documents List only displays files/documents owned by the user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29206].
  {panel}

* Support for multi-level ordered and unordered lists. 
* Support for Heading 7,8, and 9

I have attached one of our template Word documents which I have used as a test import. 

I'm trying to get more than just our tech and PM teams onto Confluence. As we venture outside of the core PM and technical teams, the demand for smoother Word document import has grown. 

Please see the attached Word Document for the kind of complexities I am talking about. 

Kind regards, 
James C

Confluence Synchronization with another instance
Application Navigator option to launch links in new tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29200].
  {panel}

In a Confluence page, I want to embed a JIRA issues macro in an Expand macro, and display it in dynamic mode.

I have managed to do this on one page, but then when I repeated the action on another page, with a different filter, the issues list displayed blank. When changing to static mode it displayed ok.

I copied the first macro to the second page and it worked fine. The two macros have almost identical filtes, based on an Epic with status not in resolved or closed, and sorted by one column.

This one worked:
https://emarsys.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=%22Epic+Link%22+%3D+%22DMX+Austria%22+and+status+not+in+%28closed%2C+resolved%29+ORDER+BY+due+ASC&tempMax=1000

This one did not:
https://emarsys.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=%22Epic+Link%22+%3D+%2272GTM%22+AND+status+not+in+%28closed%2C+resolved%29+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC&tempMax=1000


This ticket created after receiving a reply from by Mick Nassette to a question (ID: 165602)
